Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Paul Wolfram  Paul
Instructor: Paul Wolfram  Paul Wolfram
Instructor: Paul Wolfram  He was good but not great.
Instructor: Paul Wolfram  Paul
Instructor: Paul Wolfram  great job! very thoughtful & careful
Instructor: Paul Wolfram  Paul Wolfram was the TF for Spring 2017.
Instructor: Paul Wolfram  Paul Wolfram
Instructor: Paul Wolfram  Paul Wolfram

Instructor: Paul Wolfram  Paul was available to schedule office hours and helpful in explaining Sima Pro qualitatively.

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Paul Wolfram  I did not interact greatly with the TF.
Instructor: Paul Wolfram  Paul really understands the content of this course, and was very helpful with many aspects of the course. He was a great resource in helping with our final projects.

Instructor: Paul Wolfram  Weakness: He was not available a lot of times so I had to rely on other classmates when questions came up. And he did not seem knowledgeable enough to be a TA for this course especially with Sima Pro. Strength: He was nice.
Instructor: Paul Wolfram  Paul was helpful when approached with questions, and would have improved by taking a more active role assisting with the client projects.
Instructor: Paul Wolfram  He was very helpful on homework assignments. Also very helpful on projects.

Instructor: Paul Wolfram  Paul was very accessible and helpful with general LCA and SimaPro related questions. Gave constructive feedback and supporting materials to clarify things we were struggling with. No complaints.
Instructor: Paul Wolfram  Helpful to meet one-on-one with students with specific questions. Could be a bit more prepared explaining how the Simapro software works, but overall helpful.
Instructor: Paul Wolfram  I would suggest that the TA holds weekly optional group tutorial sessions in the computer lab for LCA.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I really enjoyed this course and Tom was very helpful.

Tom Swarr was an incredible resource when working through the client projects. He was also very realistic when describing the strengths and limitations of LCA as a tool for measuring environmental impacts.

In this version of the course, Edgar Hertwich had minimal involvement, only coming in for two or three lectures more along his area of expertise (carbon footprinting, energy sources). Thomas Swarr was the most involved with the course and was great during lecture. A suggestion to make class more compelling is to directly/explicitly reference the readings for each lecture. It felt like most students were disengaged with lecture and material that was interesting and important to understand because we did not complete the readings and were not properly situated in each topic prior to class.

The information gained about using SimaPro software was very useful, but unfortunately I'm concerned that this software is obsolete in many instances and that most employers no longer use this. The topic of life cycle assessment is fascinating but unfortunately the lectures do not do it justice and a majority of the students did not even listen to the lectures, nor did they do the reading.
The client project was very helpful. Class time was not helpful

Professor Swarr is very patient and helpful. I appreciate that he encouraged our opinions on how to make the course better. He is also constantly checking in to see how we felt or where we were with the project or software, understanding fully well how frustrating the process can me. Offered helpful additional materials to support the project and constructive feedback for homework and project work.

The course was really inefficient. You couldn't do any work with your client until you learned the software and that took half of the semester. then it was too little time to do much with your client. I suggest splitting into two courses. Thomas was really nice but most lectures felt pointless and I didn't get much from them. I wish he would compress his toughts and only talk about the most important stuff. We should use the time in class towards the end of the semester to work with our clients and have the prof be there to help us. It would be goo to have office hours in the comp lab.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: THE PROJECT, BY FAR.
I loved working on a group project with a real client to apply what was learned in the class.
My favorite thing was how practical it was.
I enjoyed working on the client project and putting the skills learned in the problem sets to work on a real example.

LCA is so important to know and understand! If only more companies and clients were interested in measuring and quantifying their potential environmental impact through LCA. But this course allows you to understand the theoretical framing of LCA in addition to learning how to use the most comprehensive (and complex) analytical software to perform LCA modeling.

The client project because it gave us a chance to build a model in LCA. I wish that the TA had been encouraged to meet with each group before they started their model to go over the approach since our group built our model incorrectly and it would have been beneficial to have assistance in identifying the best approach.

Good 'hard' / practical skill to have for students interested in the Industrial Ecology / Corporate Sustainability space. Software aside, the course also provides general framework for understanding how a product's impact are assessed. The client project was very rewarding especially if the clients are LCA experts themselves.
working on a real world project
Very practical and real world experience. Opportunity to learn a new tool, LCA Team work is plentiful Applicability to other fields

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: lectures didn't help with my knowledge base. I would recommend getting into simapro more often

It was hard to jump into working with a client without truly understanding the SimaPro software first. We were asking our client for data based on what we thought we might need, and then going back to them as we learned more of what was required to build our model, and eventually it got too late in the project to keep asking for more data.

LCA is a critical skill to have (or at least understand) for those going into CSR. However, learning the foundations of the course at the same time as consulting with a real world client is not an appropriate model. Additionally, not having the class in a computer lab is a huge mistake. Learning was significantly impeded by not being able to work through software issues with the instructor in real time. Conceptual material would have been much better understood, had it been applied to a model built in class. Big missed opportunity here.
More case studies would have been nice.
The SimaPro learning curve is quite steep, so perhaps having one class a week in the computer lab to work through the software foundations together would be beneficial.

This course has a lot of material to fit into one semester. I feel that there needs to be a more comprehensive effort devoted to LCA theory and knowledge, even if it would probably be dry and boring for most students. But with LCA methodology as flexible and sometimes arbitrary as it is allowed to be, there should be more training and discussion around what is and what isn't permissible, else we leave the class learning incorrect methodologies and parameters for carrying out LCA. This is already touched upon throughout the class, but I think it was somewhat lost once the client projects started and it was difficult to just keep all streams of thought separate once we were dealing with so much knowledge.

The lectures. Maybe there could be a way that each student has an LCA topic that they have to learn and then they each present to make it more interesting. I liked the homework assignments and really enjoyed the client project.

More support on software. A lab is totally necessary for this class. Simply showing how the software works in class is not helpful. Having lecture held in a computer lab might solve this problem. OR having a 1-3 hour lab section a week where both the TA and professor are there to help answer software questions could be offered as a stand in if the lecture is not taught in a lab.

First, you are definitely disadvantaged if you don't have SimaPro readily on your personal computer/laptop. The software was incompatible with my Mac and SimaPro is something you want to open multiple times a day to experiment and explore with. Finding time to work at the IT lab proved to be challenging. At the end I felt I was still not exposed enough to the software. The structure of the course which included the client project detracted from us building our SimaPro skills. The project was demanding and there were other aspects such as communications, data availability and report building that you had to juggle on top of the other homework. A bit too much, as almost all of us were new to the software and just wanted time to understand it better. I think that most of us took the course to be versed in the software and deciphering the impact assessments. Not sure we full achieved that.

There is too much material covered in this course - how to use Simapro, lifecycle analysis, and working with a client all at the same time is a bit overwhelming and you don't feel ready to dive in with your client until you're comfortable using the software. Also, the client scope should be more clear and the client's expectations should be the same as the students. It would be helpful to have one session or an evening session on setting up a proper timeline and meeting deliverables throughout the semester in order to deliver solid recommendations and analysis.
Structure of the course does not work. Split into two courses.

Classes should be held in the computer lab. More individual assignments Weekly group tutorial sessions for Sima Pro More critical discussion and examples from Sima Pro during the conceptual classes (power points)

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: n/a
There was no lab.
More case studies.
The lectures could be more engaging and tie more directly into the client projects.

We should have class in Sage Lab or CSSSI Lab! It would be a huge boon to Mac users and others who don't have SimaPro on their computers to be able to follow along during class and get more hands-on time with the software.

No, there was no lab and it was a huge problem. All the students taught each other in the lab constantly like a family all the time. Would have been great to have faculty support on this. Client project could have been greatly improved earlier on in the semester if there were a lab with faculty support associated with this class.
One of the classes needs to be lab based so we can actually learn the software
The lectures where we discussed how to use Simapro should have been held in the lab so that we could try it then and there since many students had a difficult time downloading it onto their laptops.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: it's vital to my studies in industrial ecology and CSR.
See comments above. This is a critical component of corporate sustainability.
This course was a practicum but I do not think a lot of people in this course were not ready for a practicum so maybe having a prerequisite before enrolling this course might be helpful.
LCA thinking is very relevant to the Industrial Ecology field. While LCA is touched on in other classes, this course goes into much more detail and uses the actual LCA software.

Very important for the Industrial Ecology and Green Design specialization of the MEM, and important knowledge for other disciplines as well. It's a great capstone for those who are more technically-oriented, though I think it would be a good complement to the business and the environment clinic course.

This course fits in well for students looking to do supply chain management or CSR and I thought it was really interesting. I wish the instructor required that we do the readings since I think I could have learned more about LCA outside of learning about SimaPro software.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: INTEREST in the subject matter; requirement for track.
Learning about LCAs fits into my career goal of working on industrial ecology in the business space.
Wanted to learn sima pro.
I wanted to understand how these models are created in order to better analyze the validity of studies and be able to run my own assessments.
To learn about life cycle assessment as it pertains to environmental impacts.
I want to understand how software works for carbon footprinting because I'm interested in LCA and carbon accounting.
To gain practical working knowledge of an LCA software and its use.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: yeah, i feel like i can work an LCA, for sure.
Mildly. I would have liked to take a whole course on just the SimaPro software, and a separate whole course on the theory of LCAs and how they are used.
No
Yes, I wanted 1:1 interactions with the client and I got that.
Yes, I am able to maneuver around SimaPro and understand what is required to create a robust LCA model.
yes
Yes, very much so. I hope more and more people at FES begin to take interest in life cycle assessment!
Yes
No. I rarely got to work on the model because of my group size. I don't feel like I learned anything that will be lasting regarding Sima Pro software except that it is confusing and cumbersome.
It gave a sufficient introduction but definitely feel lacking in the software skills which was my biggest expectation coming into the course.
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Vital to the course, wouldn't have been able to complete the project on my own. Also lucked out with a good group.

There is also a difficulty inherent to group work related to SimaPro. Only one or two people can work on a model like this at once, but if you don't work on the model then you cannot write the report of the project because you don't understand the model. Myself and one other group member volunteered to build the model, and then eventually had to write the whole report anyway because our two other group members did not understand the project. There was no way around this.

We had SIGNIFICANT free rider issues. There is no team evaluation component of the course, so there is virtually no accountability. Also, with the limitations of the software, building a model and revising it throughout the semester as a team is incredibly difficult and slow moving.
Group work was good

I enjoyed the group work aspect of this course, particularly since we worked well together and shared the project work evenly. With larger groups, it would have been challenging to share the same SimaPro database and split up the group work among all the team members.

The client project would have been nearly impossible to have done alone. The group worked together, (except one individual who did next to no work), and we were able to collaborate on building the model in SimaPro and helped one another in understanding the project.
Needed more support on the model. Hard to all learn the software in a large group.
A lot of the group members did not put in there fair share of work. It was difficult to break up the model work among 4 people

Luck factor here. My team mates were great and efficient and we had wonderful clients (GE). GE had LCA specialists and dedicated an engineer for the project. Thus we had plenty of expert help and data to work with, unlike some of the other teams. Because of the software's limitation to transfer project data between computers, only one of us ended up intensively working with the software.
Learned from my group mate and got practice using Simapro and analyzing the data.
Helpful to have different backgrounds and slipt up the work (though one team member did nothing...)

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Start the group project earlier.
If you are interested in Industrial Ecology, this is a great course to take. You will learn how to use a specific software (SimaPro) and will use it for a real, client-based project.
Please only take this course if you want a practical course... This course is very practical and less focus on the theory.
Be prepared to work with limited data and fill in the gaps with existing literature. Be comfortable making model assumptions and dealing with ambiguous conclusions. And dive right in to SimaPro!

DO THE READING! Or at least skim it. I wish I had done more of the reading. It helps if you are more technically- or detail-oriented, because LCA is equal parts theoretical framing and technical pieces.
Learning SimaPro is useful but I would recommend doing the readings and learning about LCA outside of SimaPro.
Push hard for there to be a lab with faculty support IN the lab.

Make sure you have enough memory on your laptop and that the software is compatible with it. This defines your whole interaction with the course. Course administrators should stress this for incoming students. We were told that the course structure will change in a way that students will be more hands-on with the software. This is great, dive in and explore the software as much as you can!
Helpful and interesting but a lot of work and not very well structured.
